text: hey everybody Thomas Joseph here now
baked meringues they're one of my
favorite things they have that signature
pale crisp exterior with that
marshmallow like interior that's so
delicious
but most recipes yield something that's
crumbly and dry throughout well today
I'm going to show you a recipe that has
a few secret ingredients and a little
bit of a trick and a tip here along the
way and you will have the most delicious
meringues I promise
so how do we start I have four egg
whites here and whenever you're making
something with egg whites you want to
make sure that they are at room
temperature into a clean mixing bowl
here free of grease or any type of
detergent because any fat or residue
will keep the whites from whipping and
creating all of that volume start on
medium speed you're going to whisk the
egg whites until they're slightly foamy
add a hefty pinch of kosher salt this
will help to further break up the egg
whites and it gives a little bit of
flavor now I'm going to increase the
speed and I want to take these egg
whites up to a soft peak so the egg
whites here they are glossy they're at
soft peaks you can see right here and
now this is the point when you want to
add the sugar so I have one cup plus 2
tablespoons of superfine sugar that's
caster sugar gradually add it so that it
can dissolve into the egg whites and you
don't get that grainy texture and then
feed this mixture until it's nice and
stiff and glossy the meringue is nice
and glossy and it's holding a stiff peak
fold in two teaspoons of white vinegar
and white vinegar you could use lemon
juice here what this does is it helps to
stabilize the meringue and it retains
all of that volume another secret
ingredient is a teaspoon of cornstarch
and what cornstarch does it also helps
in the stabilization in that
absorbs any excess moisture so fold that
in and now not really a secret
ingredient but really important when it
comes to flavor a teaspoon of vanilla so
you're going to fold all of these
ingredients into the meringue now make
sure your oven is preheated to 300
degrees Fahrenheit with the rack in the
middle of the oven I have a piece of
parchment here that I've drawn a 8-inch
circle and what you want to do is you
want to flip the parchment over and this
is going to be my guide when mounting my
meringue now today I'm showing you how
to make a pavlova which is a type of
baked meringue but you could easily pipe
this same batter really out into little
kisses with a pastry tip you could
really make any shape or size that you
would like the technique is all the same
you're just going to have to change the
baking time so mound up your meringue
right in the center of the circle take
an offset spatula you could use a spoon
here and push the meringue out towards
the edge swoop and swirl to give a
little extra dimension okay so this goes
right into the oven and as soon as you
put in the oven turn the oven
temperature down to 250 degrees and
you're going to bake your have lova for
an hour and 15 minutes turn the oven off
and let it cool in the oven until it is
completely cooled alright so as you can
see the meringue has puffed it's nice
and crisp on the outside
remember cool it completely in the oven
and with this recipe you will have that
wonderful crisp crust but you'll have
that delicious soft marshmallow like
interior serve this up with some whipped
cream and some berries or any other
fruit and you have a real treat but make
sure you serve it right away enjoy
